alert.note: Alert for Bowie (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 05 at 12:06AM CDT until October 05 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arkansas, including the following county, Miller. Portions of northeast Texas, including the following counties, Bowie, Cass and Morris. * WHEN...Until 315 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1206 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Texarkana, Atlanta, Linden, Queen City, Redwater, Maud, Bivins, Bloomburg, Douglassville, Marietta, Domino, Red Hill, Bryans Mill and Spring Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
